DataElement.preferredDefinition: The period of time from blood supply separation or reduction to further processing, preservation, or blood supply reconnection of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue segment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._The time interval from blood supply separation or reduction to further processing, preservation, or blood supply reconnection for a tissue, organ, or body part.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into one to three aliquots of non-neoplastic ("normal") adjacent tissue (as feasible) suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample with cellular composition and architectural patterns expected for the particular anatomic site in which it belongs. There is no evidence of abnormal cellular infiltrates or tumor mass formation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The time interval from blood supply separation or reduction to further processing, preservation, or blood supply reconnection for a tissue, organ, or body part.

Concepts.definition: The time interval from blood supply separation or reduction to further processing, preservation, or blood supply reconnection for a tissue, organ, or body part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/15/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/24/20 jk created CPTAC Solid tumor procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: In modern usage, an hour is defined as a unit of time 60 minutes, or 3600 seconds in length. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CPTAC-Tumor-Procurement-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ischemic time: ≤35M Except LUAD/LSCC ≤50M PDA ≤55M BLCA robotic ≤50M CHOL extrahepatic ≤55M
